meanings.definition: To turn into or treat as a myth
meanings.sent1: The ancient story was mythologized by the villagers.
meanings.sent2: Legends often get mythologized over time.
meanings.sent3: The children mythologized their teacher's ability to see through walls.
meanings.sent4: Her bravery in the face of danger was mythologized by all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The artist mythologized the ordinary cat into a magical creature in her painting.

meanings.definition: To create a myth or myths about
meanings.sent1: The author mythologized the origins of the mysterious island.
meanings.sent2: People tend to mythologize historical figures.
meanings.sent3: The students mythologized the legend of the haunted school to scare each other.
meanings.sent4: The politician's rise to power was mythologized in the media.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller mythologized the ordinary stone into a magical talisman.

meanings.sent1: The hero's deeds were mythologized by bards across the land.
meanings.sent2: Ancient civilizations often mythologized natural phenomena.
meanings.sent3: The chef mythologized the recipe for the perfect chocolate cake.
meanings.sent4: The mountain, shrouded in mist, was mythologized by the locals.
meanings.sent5: The old castle was mythologized into a place of ghostly legends.
